commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Refresh Running Browsers no longer requires each to be installed
commits.body: When converting this to a standalone script it inadvertently also asked for the location of each browser, with a few tricks this no longer happens.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.body: This tag is always stand alone (no closing tag).

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Remove conditional from Preview in All Active Browsers
commits.body: This is no longer needed as support was cut for 10.4 and under long ago.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Switch to pure AppleScript for Refresh Running Browser(s)
commits.body:
This simplifies the script as Safari has ballooned into many separate processes some which are left open without Safari. Removes support for Internet Explorer because… yeah… also removes support for OmniWeb as will not currently run under El Capitan. Adds support for WebKit nightly releases.

Note: Due to AppleScript features used this now requires 10.5+

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Disable tag snippets inside PHP and other embedded code

commits.author: Kai Wood
commits.summary: Change regex to match HTML tags better
commits.body:
Since 04a714a465f7deba2c0618a0024adc843c93e805 one can use Select Enclosing Typing Pairs for HTML tags. This fails short if custom HTML tags are in between, like Angular directives (which contain dashes, "-") or some of the tags Facebook uses for its integration stuff (which contain double colons, ":").

With this change, one can select the typing pairs properly.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Move PHP specific folding settings to PHP bundle

commits.author: David Gasperoni
commits.summary: Remove title and charset on link tags
commits.body: Same result of https://github.com/textmate/html.tmbundle/pull/36, but for drag-and-dropped stylesheets

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Grammar: Allow for unquoted id attribute values

commits.author: David Gasperoni
commits.summary: Remove title and charset attributes from link tags
commits.body: While 'charset' is plainly discouraged (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/link#attr-charset), title attribute on link tags is something rarely used and with implications that authors might not be aware of (http://stackoverflow.com/a/1959975/1092853).

commits.author: David Gasperoni
commits.summary: Removed charset on inline script tag
commits.body: See [this article on html optimization](http://perfectionkills.com/optimizing-html/#8_script_charset) for the rationale on this.

commits.author: Kai Wood
commits.body:
Should match every proper case now:

- lower case / upper case
- single and double quotes and leaving quotes out (see HTML5 spec) after the type attribute
- without type attribute (defaults to JavaScript as of HTML5)

Closes #22

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Don't set disableIndentCorrections for embedded source
commits.body: This scope closely mirrors the `text - text source` scope of the similar setting in the Text bundle. This allows indentation to work unhindered in embedded source such as PHP.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Allow disableIndentCorrections to affect all html subtypes
commits.body: This should be the desired setting for most html types, certain types such as markdown may need an override or a setting of their own.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.body: Instead we will increase scope specificity in the Blogging bundle.
